poem:
Title: "Lines on a Morning Press"

Body Shop stripped bare and broken,
Snack stashes steadily shrinking, spoken.
Warnings spill from Washington's throne, 
Nightmare of a Brexit-gnawed bone.

Goldman Sachs, with calculative eyes,
Unearth fault lines a country belies.
Under our skins, a dissipating treasure,
Reality's GDP, beyond measure.

As Yorkshire skies spew smoke and mist,
Remember, man is more than a capitalist.
